greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(0)=0, for n >= 1, a(2n) = a(n)+1, a(4n-1) = a(n)+1, a(4n+1) = a(n)+1.
comment: a(n) gives the index of the greatest prime dividing A260443(n).
Each n >= 1 occurs for the first time at 2^(n-1), which are also the positions of records.
For n >= 1, a(n) = number of terms in row n of A125184.
program: (define (A277329 n) (if (zero? n) n (+ 1 (A057526 n)))) ;; Code for A057526 given in that entry.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 27 2016
